paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a single nucleotide deletion mutation in the KCNH2 gene associated with long QT syndrome in a Korean family.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Thus, I2, II2, II4, II7 (proband), and III1 were all heterozygotes for delC453fs (151Pfs+15X).
Thus, I2, II2, II4, II7 (proband), and III1 were all heterozygotes for delC453fs (151Pfs+15X).

individual_records.phenotype_details: Prolonged QTc interval with non-specific T-wave abnormality
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Subject II4 was diagnosed as LQTS based on the non-specific T-wave abnormality despite of shorter QTc interval than normal one.
Thus, I2, II2, II4, II7 (proband), and III1 were all heterozygotes for delC453fs (151Pfs+15X).
Thus, I2, II2, II4, II7 (proband), and III1 were all heterozygotes for delC453fs (151Pfs+15X).

functional_data.summary: The delC453 mutation presumably leads to deficiency in the rapid delayed rectifier potassium channel, resulting in prolonged open state and reduced repolarizing current.

variants.segregation_data: This mutation co-segregated with LQTS in this family.
variants.population_frequency: This mutation was not detected in 100 chromosomes in the general Korean population.
variants.additional_notes: The penetrance of LQTS in this family was assumed to be 100%.

The penetrance of LQTS in this family was assumed to be 100%.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
